event: Thai media reports Royal Thai Army spokesperson denies Cambodia’s claims of An Ses incursion, asserting Thailand’s commitment to the ceasefire.

Thai armed forces, with excavators, enter An Ses in Cambodian sovereign territory, laying barbed wire despite Cambodian objections, violating the July 28 ceasefire. Cambodia requests ICRC mediation to facilitate the release of captured soldiers.
Cambodia reports calm at the frontline but maintains high alertness, reaffirming commitment to the July 28 ceasefire and urging reliance on official sources.
King Norodom Sihamoni authorizes Hun Sen to lead national defense coordination, granting full use of RCAF, including palace guards, akin to martial law, to protect Cambodia’s sovereignty.
Thailand’s Acting Minister of National Defense accepts Cambodia’s proposal for Malaysia, U.S., and China to observe the General Border Committee (GBC) meeting, reversing earlier rejection.

Cambodia reports Thai military plans to launch attacks from Ta Moan Thom, Ta Krabey, Preah Vihear, and An Ses, violating the July 28 ceasefire. Thailand initially rejects Cambodia’s proposal for Malaysia, U.S., and China to observe the GBC meeting.
Thai media reports Cambodian drones flying into Thai territory, which Cambodia rejects as false, accusing Thailand of misinformation to escalate tensions.
Thailand returns two of 20 captured Cambodian soldiers, who Cambodia claims were brutally tortured, suffering physical and psychological harm. Thailand asserts they were treated humanely.
172,094 Cambodians displaced: Siem Reap (61,907), Oddar Meanchey (39,546), Banteay Meanchey (35,057), Preah Vihear (32,558), Pursat (3,026).

Thai forces enter Cambodian territory near the border, initially appearing friendly and requesting photos, then capture 20 Cambodian soldiers, allegedly violating the ceasefire. Cambodia denies Thai accusations of violating the ceasefire.
Ceasefire agreed in Malaysia, mediated by Anwar Ibrahim and Trump.
Fighting spreads to six areas; over 100,000 displaced across Cambodia and Thailand.
Cambodian forces retaliate in self-defense against Thai aggression.

Thai Second Army Region blocks access to Ta Moan Thom temple. Thai forces initiate fire on Cambodian troops at Ta Moan Thom, extending to Ta Krabei temple, Phnom Kmoach, and Mom Bei in Preah Vihear province, using jet fighters.
Thailand fires into the sky, escalating tensions.
Thailand hovers drone(s) for 2 minutes near Ta Moan Thom temple.
Thailand violates bilateral agreements by installing barbed wire at Ta Moan Thom temple.
Second landmine explosion in disputed area. Thailand expels Cambodian ambassador and recalls their own.
Thai soldier steps on war-era landmine in disputed area, accuses Cambodia of laying new mines.
Thai PM suspended, demonstrating internal political instability.
Cambodia attempts peaceful negotiations, met with Thai refusal and non-cooperation.
Leaked phone call from Thai PM to Hun Sen sparks outrage; Thai politics destabilized. Cambodia halts Thai imports in response to Thai threats and unilateral border closures.
Cambodia submits ICJ application, seeking legal solution to border dispute.
Cambodian soldier killed during brief firefight in Preah Vihear.
